labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is a research automation tool that combines advanced AI models (Gemini) with search capabilities to perform comprehensive web research. It automates iterative research processes, tracks citations, identifies knowledge gaps, and organizes research outputs. The core functionality revolves around web-based research and automated browsing.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality aligns closely with web search and research, as it primarily uses AI and search tools to gather and organize information. Browser automation is also relevant due to its ability to perform iterative automated research tasks. Memory management is a secondary consideration since it helps organize research outputs. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover its primary functions well.

server_info_crawled.name: Gemini LangGraph Research Server
server_info_crawled.author: @albinjal/gemini-lg-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Perform comprehensive web research using Google's Gemini AI models combined with Google Search and LangGraph. Automate multi-angle research with smart search strategies, iterative follow-ups, and citation tracking to deliver structured, organized research data. Save time and improve research quality with automated knowledge gap identification and source preservation.

tools.name: collect_research
tools.description: Deploy Server Gemini LangGraph Research Server @albinjal/gemini-lg-mcp Try in Playground collect_research

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@albinjal/gemini-lg-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
